meanings.sent1: The young fumbler dropped the ball during the game.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was a fumbler when it came to using the computer.
meanings.sent3: The fumbler tried to juggle but ended up dropping all the balls.
meanings.sent4: She was a fumbler in the kitchen, always spilling ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The fumbler's hands were like magnets for accidents.

meanings.sent1: He would fumbler with the keys, struggling to unlock the door.
meanings.sent2: She tends to fumbler with her phone when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The fumbler tried to tie his shoelaces but ended up in a knot.
meanings.sent4: She fumblered with the puzzle pieces, unable to fit them together.
meanings.sent5: The child fumblered with the toy, unsure of how to play with it.

meanings.definition: To make awkward attempts to do or handle something.
meanings.sent1: He would often fumbler through his speeches, forgetting his lines.
meanings.sent2: She tends to fumbler through new tasks until she gets the hang of them.
meanings.sent3: The fumbler tried to dance but kept stepping on toes.
meanings.sent4: She fumblered through the conversation, unsure of what to say next.
meanings.sent5: The student fumblered through the exam, struggling to remember the answers.
